title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
description:
Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

Sam Bankman-Fried has reportedly responded to several media inquiries via email, claiming that he never thought his actions as F were a breach of the law. Meanwhile, Tether has been busy adding to its Bitcoin stash, announcing a recent acquisition of nearly 9,000 BTC, and Tron has accused the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) of overreach, arguing the agency’s lawsuit against it crosses international jurisdiction and goes “too far.” 

Former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried responded to questioning following his 25-year prison sentence last week, stating that, “I never thought what I was doing was illegal.”

As reported by ABC News, the former executive responded to questions via email from the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, New York, where he has been held since last August.

Read more

title: Anticipation builds as Elon Musk’s X platform inches closer to Dogecoin integration
description: The dogecoin community reminisces about Twitter’s logo a moment before the anniversary, as it used the DOGE logo for its credit. title: Nearshoring Tech: U.S. Giants Propel AI Server Manufacturing from Taiwan to Mexico
description: The U.S. technology behemoths are cajoling their Taiwanese partners, who specialize in the production of AI servers, to set up shop in Mexico, a possible continuation of the changes in global dynamics related to manufacturing. This strategic move, as also underlined in an article from The Wall Street Journal, does testify, on one hand, the […]

title: VeChain’s Next Chapter: VET Founder Sunny Lu Offers Insights in Exclusive Interview
description: VeChain Founder Sunny Lu has teased the future of the protocol with a strong tilt toward sustainability. title: BSX – the First CLOB Perp Exchange To Launch on Base Layer-Two Blockchain
description:

title: Former Binance Head Changpeng Zhao Now Doing Dozens of Interviews per Week for New Project
description:
Binance founder and former CEO Changpeng Zhao is busy with a new project that aims to reduce the world’s illiteracy rate. title: Tether Announces Completion of ‘Gold Standard’ Security Audit in Push for Regulatory Compliance
description:
